section.title: General Overview
section.para: The purpose of Domibus is to facilitate B2B communication. To achieve this goal it provides a very flexible plugin model which allows for integration with nearly all BOA s.
There are two default plugins available with the Domibus distribution, the domibus-default-jms-plugin JMS-ICD and the domibus-default-ws-pluginWS-ICD.

section.title: Plugin Structure
section.para: A plugin is only dependent on the domibus-plugin-api module which is released together with the main Domibus application. Any changes to previous API versions will be addressed in a migration guide. While the default plugins use the Spring framework for dependency injection this is not mandatory.

A plugin consists of implementations of at least two interfaces and one abstract class. The extension of
and an implementation of both
and.

This way multiple plugins can share the same data formats while using different transport protocols or enforcing different security policies. It also is possible to implement transport handlers for protocols while keeping the actual data format pluggable.

figure.title: Message reception by the backend and delivery to the plugin (PUSH mode)

section.title: Pull and Push plugins
section.para:
There are two different ways of communicating with the backend. The first one is.PULL. A plugin operationg under this mode initiates all communication with the Domibus MSH by itself and is never called from the Domibus itself. This mode is intended mostly for backend applications that are not always online (e.g. mobile devices). The default Webservice plugin bundled with Domibus is an example of such a plugin. The major disadvantage of this mode is that there is no way for Domibus to report processing errors back to the plugin, relying on calls to
by the backend to be informed about any error conditions.

The preferred way of implementing a plugin is.PUSH. This mode allows Domibus to push notifications and incoming messages to the backend. In case the backend is not reachable the notification will be retried according to the backend queue definition as described in. The default bundled JMS plugin is an example of such a plugin.

section.title: Extending
section.para:
provides implementations of most methods defined in
and should be used as basis for every plugin. depending on the desired
different methods have to be overridden:
.PULL

To submit a message to the MSH the
implementation of
should be used. To download a message a combination of
and
should be used.

.PUSH
This only must be overridden if the plugin is to be used for exchanges utilizing error reporting features. If this method is not overridden an UnsupportedOperationException will be raised.
If no reporting is required this method may be overridden with an empty implementation
Additionally
is only callable from Mode.PULL plugins

To submit a message to the MSH the
implementation of
should be used.

section.title:
Implementing
and
section.para: The implementations of the transformer classes are responsible for transformation between the native backend formats and. As there are two different interfaces to implement it is possible to use different DTOs for message submission and reception. This is convenient when those tasks are handled by different backend applications.

As
is able to represent all kinds of messages there are many parameters that must be set, with some of them unknown to the backend application. One approach is to statically set those values in the transformer classes. Another, more flexible approach is the usage of overridable default settings as used in the bundled default JMS plugin. For further details see jms-icd.

section.title: Plugin configuration and deployment
section.para: To use the plugin it has to be configured and made available to the main Domibus application. The Tomcat version of Domibus comes with a preconfigured context.xml file which allows JAR files located in ${catalina.base}/conf/domibus/plugins/lib to be accessed by Domibus. Deploying the JAR conrtaining the plugin into this folder makes it available. The deployment of the domibus-plugin-api artifact is not advisable, as the main Domibus application brings its own version of it.

The plugin configuration is handled using theSpring framework. Each plugin brings its own configuration file named${pluginName}-plugin.xml. Those must be deployed to ${domibus.config.location2}/plugins/config. All bundled plugins come with a ${pluginName}-example.xml, providing a configuration example for the plugin.

The above example shows the default configuration of the provided webservice plugin. Every configuration contains at least three parts:
implementation of
a notification queue
a bean of type eu.domibus.plugin.NotificationListenerService

The notification queue has to be created on the JMS server used by Domibus. See
and
on the JMS configuration. In case of Mode.PUSH plugins the retry policy of this queue equals the retry policy of backend notifications. It is recommended to set a retry delay to avoid unneccessary retries (and log entries) in case a backend is not available. Please note that the example uses the Domibus default ActiveMQ JMS provider. If you use a different provider the amq: namespace will not work.

The eu.domibus.plugin.NotificationListenerService bean is required for Domibus to communicate with the plugin. To set up it is required to pass the mode, the queue and a reference to the implementation of.

Additional, plugin specific configuration can also be added to the file. In the example <jaxws:endpoint> element is used to expose the webservice called by the backend application. Correspondingly the example JMS configuration file defines a number of queues and Spring JMS templates.

section.title:
getCategory()
getCategory
Methods getCategory
section.para: "This OPTIONAL attribute identifies the type of error related to a particular origin. For example: Content, Packaging, UnPackaging, Communication, InternalProcess." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

section.title:
getSeverity()
getSeverity
Methods getSeverity
section.para: "This REQUIRED attribute indicates the severity of the error. Valid values are: warning, failure. The warning value indicates that a potentially disabling condition has been detected, but no message processing and/or exchange has failed so far. In particular, if the message was supposed to be delivered to a consumer, it would be delivered even though a warning was issued. Other related messages in the conversation or MEP can be generated and exchanged in spite of this problem. The failure value indicates that the processing of a message did not proceed as expected, and cannot be considered successful. If, in spite of this, the message payload is in a state of being delivered, the default behavior is not to deliver it, unless an agreement states otherwise (see OpCtx-ErrorHandling). This error does not presume the ability of the MSH to process other messages, although the conversation or the MEP instance this message was involved in is at risk of being invalid." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

section.title:
getShortDescription()
getShortDescription
Methods getShortDescription
section.para: "This OPTIONAL attribute provides a short description of the error that can be reported in a log, in order to facilitate readability." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

section.title:
getErrorCode()

section.para: "This OPTIONAL attribute identifies the functional module within which the error occurred. This module could be the the ebMS Module, the Reliability Module, or the Security Module. Possible values for this attribute include "ebMS", "reliability", and "security". The use of other modules, and thus their corresponding @origin values, may be specified elsewhere, such as in a forthcoming Part 2 of this specification." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

section.title: Error­Result
section.para: This interface describes Objects representing ebMS3 error messages. those could i.­e. be exceptions, database entities or xml elements.

entry.para: the error detail message as produced by the MSH generating the error
the internal ID of the erroneous message
MSHRole.­SENDING if the related message was outgiong. MSHRole.­RECIEVING if the related message was incoming

the time the corresponding backend plugin was made aware of this error or null if there was no corresponding backend found or the corresponding PMode is set to not forward error messages. This is controlled by PMode[1].­errorHandling.­Report.­ProcessErrorNotifyConsumer and PMode[1].­errorHandling.­Report.­ProcessErrorNotifyProducer respectively
the time when this error was generated/received

section.title: ACKNOWLEDGED
section.para: the message has been sent and acknowledged by the receiving MSH. The nature of the acknowledgement (http 2xx, NRR receipt etc.­) is dependent on the corresponding message PMode.

section.title: ACKNOWLEDGED_WITH_WARNING
section.para: the message has been sent and acknowledged by the receiving MSH with an acknowledgement containing an ebMS3 error of severity WARNING. The nature of the acknowledgement(http 2xx, NRR receipt etc.­) is dependent on the corresponding message PMode. This IS CONSIDERED a SUCCESSFUL message transfer.

section.title: DELETED
section.para: The message has been processed by the MSH but the payloads have been deleted due to the message retention policy of the corresponding PMode.

section.title: NOT_FOUND
section.para: The corresponding message can not be found on the server. This indicates a request with an erroneous messageId

section.title: READY_TO_SEND
section.para: The message is ready to be put in the send queue .

section.title: RECEIVED
section.para: The message has been received successfully.

section.title: RECEIVED_WITH_WARNINGS
section.para: The message has been received and an acknowledgement containing an ebMS3 error of severity WARNING has been returned to the sender. This IS CONSIDERED a SUCCESSFUL message transfer.

section.title: SEND_ATTEMPT_FAILED
section.para: The last attempt to send the message has failed. There will either be retries, or the status will change to SEND_FAILURE (depending on the corresponding PMode)

section.title: SEND_ENQUEUED
section.para: The message is in the send queue.

section.title: SEND_FAILURE
section.para: The final send attempt of the message has failed and there will be no more retries

section.title: SEND_IN_PROGRESS
section.para: the message is being transferred to another MSH.

section.title: WAITING_FOR_RECEIPT
section.para: the message has been sent, but no receipt has been received yet.

section.title: WAITING_FOR_RETRY
section.para: The last attempt to send the message has failed. There will be a retry once the waiting interval of the corresponding PMode has passed.

section.title: Notification­Type
section.para: The types of notifications that can be submitted to a backoffice application.

section.title: Message­Not­Found­Exception
section.para: This exception indicates that a message with the requested id could not be found on the MSH. The reason might be that the message does not exist at all or that it is associated with a different backend plugin.

Delivers the message with the associated messageId to the backend application. Plugins working in Mode.­PUSH mode MUST OVERRIDE this method. For plugins working in Mode.­PULL this method never gets called. The message can be retrieved by a subclass by calling super.­downloadMessage(messageId, target)

section.title: Submission
section.para: This class represents the datamodel of the domibus backend transport layer.

In order to simplify the process of transforming data from/to the backend this datamodel was introduced. A transformer for mapping this model into the complex ebMS3 datamodel is already implemented. Therefore for a new backend implementation it is only required to implement a simple transformation from/to the backend model and this simple datamodel.

section.title: Synopsis
section.para:

equals
getClass
hashCode
notify
notifyAll
toString
wait

section.title:
addFromParty(String, String)
addFromParty
Methods addFromParty
section.para:
This method adds one originating party to the java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Party
elements. Paramters are:
partyId: This is mapped into eb:From/eb:PartyId in ebMS described here: "This element has a string value content that identifies a party, or that is one of the identifiers of this party." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)
partyIdType: This is mapped into eb:From/eb:PartyId[@type] in ebMS descibed here: "..­. The type attribute indicates the domain of names to which the string in the content of the PartyId element belongs. It is RECOMMENDED that the value of the type attribute be a URI. It is further RECOMMENDED that these values be taken from the EDIRA , EDIFACT or ANSI ASC X12 registries. Technical specifications for the first two registries can be found at and [ISO6523] and [ISO9735], respectively. Further discussion of PartyId types and methods of construction can be found in an appendix of [ebCPPA21]. The value of any given @type attribute MUST be unique within a list of PartyId elements." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string that identifies the originating party
a string that identifies the type of the partyId

section.title:
addMessageProperty(String, String)
addMessageProperty
Methods addMessageProperty
section.para: This method adds one message property to the plugin. The optional type attribute is not set.

"Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The element is intended to be consumed outside the ebMS-specified functions. It may contain some information that qualifies or abstracts message data, or that allows for binding the message to some business process. A representation in the header of such properties allows for more efficient monitoring, correlating, dispatching and validating functions (even if these are out of scope of ebMS specification) that do not require payload access." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string representing the name of the message property
a string representing the value of the message property

section.title:
addMessageProperty(String, String, String)
addMessageProperty
Methods addMessageProperty
section.para: This method adds one message property to the plugin. "Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The element is intended to be consumed outside the ebMS-specified functions. It may contain some information that qualifies or abstracts message data, or that allows for binding the message to some business process. A representation in the header of such properties allows for more efficient monitoring, correlating, dispatching and validating functions (even if these are out of scope of ebMS specification) that do not require payload access." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007) This method allows he adding of a typed property as described in theebMS3 errata} Note that submissions containing typed properties might be rejected by ebMS3 gateways that do not support said errata.

entry.para: a string representing the name of the message property
a string representing the type of the message property
a string representing the value of the message property

section.title:
addPayload(String, DataHandler, Collection<Submission.TypedProperty>)
addPayload
Methods addPayload
section.para:
This method adds one payload to the java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Payload
elements. In this case the parameter contentId, a java.­util.­Set of payload properties and the payload data itself were set. By default a payload added with this method is considered to be NOT part of the soap body. Payload properties will be mapped into eb:PartProperties in ebMS described here: "This element has zero or more eb:Property child elements. An eb:Property element is of xs:anySimpleType (e.­g. string, URI) and has a REQUIRED @name attribute, the value of which must be agreed between partners. Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The element is intended to be consumed outside the ebMS specified functions. It may contain meta-data that qualifies or abstracts the payload data. A representation in the header of such properties allows for more efficient monitoring, correlating, dispatching and validating functions (even if these are out of scope of ebMS specification) that do not require payload access." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string that is the [RFC2392] Content-ID URI of the payload object referenced
a DataHandler array with the payload data
a java.­util.­Properties object representing the properties of this payload

section.title:
addPayload(String, DataHandler, Collection<Submission.TypedProperty>, boolean, Submission.Description, String)
addPayload
Methods addPayload
section.para:
This method adds one payload to the java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Payload
elements. In this case it is possible to set all parameters available for a payload.
contentId: Will be mapped the href attribute of the eb:partInfo element in ebMS described here: This OPTIONAL attribute has a value that is the [RFC2392] Content-ID URI of the payload object referenced, an xml:id fragment identifier, or the URL of an externally referenced resource; for example, "cid:foo@example.­com" or "#idref". The absence of the attribute href in the element eb:PartInfo indicates that the payload part being referenced is the SOAP Body element itself. For example, a declaration of the following form simply indicates that the entire SOAP Body is to be considered a payload part in this ebMS message.
payloadData: A DataHandler containing a DataSource for the paload.
payloadProperties: Payload properties will be mapped into eb:PartProperties in ebMS described here: "This element has zero or more eb:Property child elements. An eb:Property element is of xs:anySimpleType (e.­g. string, URI) and has a REQUIRED @name attribute, the value of which must be agreed between partners. Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The element is intended to be consumed outside the ebMS specified functions. It may contain meta-data that qualifies or abstracts the payload data. A representation in the header of such properties allows for more efficient monitoring, correlating, dispatching and validating functions (even if these are out of scope of ebMS specification) that do not require payload access." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)
inBody: if true the payload will be the content of the soap body. If false it will be handled as an attachment of the soap message according to SwA specification.
description: a description property. Will be mapped into a eb:Description element in ebMS
schemalocation: "URI of schema(s) that define the instance document identified in the parent PartInfo element. If the item being referenced has schema(s) of some kind that describe it (e.­g. an XML Schema, DTD and/or a database schema), then the Schema element SHOULD be present as a child of the PartInfo element. It provides a means of identifying the schema and its version defining the payload object identified by the parent PartInfo element. This metadata MAY be used to validate the Payload Part to which it refers, but the MSH is NOT REQUIRED to do so ..­." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string that is the [RFC2392] Content-ID URI of the payload object referenced
a DataHandler containing a DataSource for the paload.
a java.­util.­Properties object representing the properties of this payload
if true the payload will be the content of the soap body.­If false it will be handled as an attachment of the soap message according to SwA specification
a string representing a description property
a string representing a URI of schema(s) that define the instance document

section.title:
addToParty(String, String)
addToParty
Methods addToParty
section.para:
This method adds one destination party to the java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Party
elements. Paramters are:
partyId: This is mapped into eb:To/eb:PartyId in ebMS described here: "This element has a string value content that identifies a party, or that is one of the identifiers of this party." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)
partyIdType: This is mapped into eb:To/eb:PartyId[@type] in ebMS descibed here: "..­. The type attribute indicates the domain of names to which the string in the content of the PartyId element belongs. It is RECOMMENDED that the value of the type attribute be a URI. It is further RECOMMENDED that these values be taken from the EDIRA , EDIFACT or ANSI ASC X12 registries. Technical specifications for the first two registries can be found at and [ISO6523] and [ISO9735], respectively. Further discussion of PartyId types and methods of construction can be found in an appendix of [ebCPPA21]. The value of any given @type attribute MUST be unique within a list of PartyId elements." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string that identifies the destination party
a string that identifies the type of the partyId

section.title:
getAction()
getAction
Methods getAction
section.para: Getter for action

"This element is a string identifying an operation or an activity within a Service. Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. Action SHALL be unique within the Service in which it is defined. The value of the Action element is specified by the designer of the service." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string identifying an operation or an activity within a Service that may support several of these.

section.title:
getAgreementRef()
getAgreementRef
Methods getAgreementRef
section.para: Getter for agreementref

"AgreementRef is a string value that identifies the agreement that governs the exchange. The P-Mode under which the MSH operates for this message should be aligned with this agreement. The value of an AgreementRef element MUST be unique within a namespace mutually agreed by the two parties. This could be a concatenation of the From and To PartyId values, a URI containing the Internet domain name of one of the parties, or a namespace offered and managed by some other naming or registry service. It is RECOMMENDED that the AgreementRef be a URI." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string that identifies the entity or artifact governing the exchange of messages between the parties.

section.title:
getAgreementRefType()
getAgreementRefType
Methods getAgreementRefType
section.para: Getter for agreementRefType

"This OPTIONAL attribute indicates how the parties sending and receiving the message will interpret the value of the reference (e.­g. the value could be "ebcppa2.­1" for parties using a CPA-based agreement representation). There is no restriction on the value of the type attribute; this choice is left to profiles of this specification. If the type attribute is not present, the content of the eb:AgreementRef element MUST be a URI." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para:
a string indicating how the parties sending and receiving the message will interpret the value of the reference
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­agreementRef

section.title:
getConversationId()
getConversationId
Methods getConversationId
section.para: Getter for conversationId

"The Party initiating a conversation determines the value of the ConversationId element that SHALL be reflected in all messages pertaining to that conversation. The actual semantics of this value is beyond the scope of this specification. Implementations SHOULD provide a facility for mapping between their identification scheme and a ConversationId generated by another implementation." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string identifying the set of related messages that make up a conversation between Parties

section.title:
getFromParties()
getFromParties
Methods getFromParties
section.para:
Returns a java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Party
elements representing the fromParties of this plugin. A fromParty contains information describing the originating party.

entry.para:
a java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Party
elements containing information describing the originating party

section.title:
getFromRole()
getFromRole
Methods getFromRole
section.para: Getter for fromRole

"The REQUIRED eb:Role element occurs once, and identifies the authorized role (fromAuthorizedRole or toAuthorizedRole) of the Party sending (when present as a child of the From element) or receiving (when present as a child of the To element) the message. The value of the Role element is a non- empty string, with a default value of http://docs.­oasis-open.­org/ebxml-msg/ebms/v3.­0/ns/core/200704/defaultRole. Other possible values are subject to partner agreement." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string identifying the authorized role of the Party sending

section.title:
getMessageId()
getMessageId
Methods getMessageId
section.para: Getter for messageId

"This REQUIRED element has a value representing – for each message - a globally unique identifier conforming to MessageId [RFC2822]. Note: In the Message-Id and Content-Id MIME headers, values are always surrounded by angle brackets. However references in mid: or cid: scheme URI's and the MessageId and RefToMessageId elements MUST NOT include these delimiters." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string representing a globally unique identifier conforming to MessageId [RFC2822]

section.title:
getMessageProperties()
getMessageProperties
Methods getMessageProperties
section.para: Getter for all message properties of this plugin.

"Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The element is intended to be consumed outside the ebMS-specified functions. It may contain some information that qualifies or abstracts message data, or that allows for binding the message to some business process. A representation in the header of such properties allows for more efficient monitoring, correlating, dispatching and validating functions (even if these are out of scope of ebMS specification) that do not require payload access." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: an object of type java.­util.­Properties representing the message properties of this plugin

section.title:
getPayloads()
getPayloads
Methods getPayloads
section.para:
Returns a java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Payload
elements representing the payloads of this plugin. A
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Payload
contains information describing the payload and the payload itself.

entry.para:
a java.­util.­Set of
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­Payload
elements representing the payloads of this plugin

section.title:
getRefToMessageId()
getRefToMessageId
Methods getRefToMessageId
section.para: Getter for refToMessageId

"This OPTIONAL element occurs at most once. When present, it MUST contain the MessageId value of an ebMS Message to which this message relates, in a way that conforms to the MEP in use." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para:
a string containing the
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­messageId
value of an ebMS Message to which this messages relates

section.title:
getService()
getService
Methods getService
section.para: Getter for service

"This element identifies the service that acts on the message. Its actual semantics is beyond the scope of this specification. The designer of the service may be a standards organization, or an individual or enterprise." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para: a string identifying the service that acts on the message

section.title:
getServiceType()
getServiceType
Methods getServiceType
section.para: Getter for serviceType

"The Service element MAY contain a single @type attribute, that indicates how the parties sending and receiving the message will interpret the value of the element. There is no restriction on the value of the type attribute. If the type attribute is not present, the content of the Service element MUST be a URI." (OASIS ebXML Messaging Services Version 3.­0: Part 1, Core Features, 1 October 2007)

entry.para:
a string that indicates how the parties sending and receiving the message will interpret the
eu.­domibus.­plugin.­Submission.­service
value
